entries.text: The case may be open, but the record's about to take a turn, General. You've got a hot streak going, but I'm about to bleed the truth out of those dice - and this time, the scales of justice are going to come down in my favor.
Smoke doesn't lie, and it
Even the dead.
Sign on the dotted line - time to settle up our debts, and maybe the newcomer can learn a thing or two about how we play the game
The case is never closed, King James. We've danced this waltz before - the immortal tango of the damned. I'll take my chances, but this newcomer's debt is

The case is never closed, Mr. Bones. That debt the newcomer owes me? I'll be collecting, one way or another. And when I'm done, maybe you can tally up the evidence I've bled out of him. Smoke doesn't lie, and neither do my winning streaks. This round's mine.
Now, about that debt the newcomer owes me. Let's make this official.

The smoke curls around my face as I exhale, forming scales that flicker in the light. The case is never closed, even when the odds are stacked against me. Everyone bleeds evidence, whether they like it or not - and that newcomer owes me more than just coin
The newcomer owes me, and I don't take kindly to deadbeats. Time to collect.

The smoke curls around my fingers as I tap the case twice, feeling the weight of the newcomer's debt. Everyone bleeds evidence, Mr. Kevin, and this one's got a trail a mile wide. The case is never closed, but maybe this'll help me close the gap on

But maybe you can stitch up the mess I'm about to make on that board - if you can keep up, that is. The newcomer owes me, and I'm feeling lucky. Time to

Smoke doesn't lie - and it's telling me you're feeling a bit too smug for your own good.

Stitch-Up. Fancy running into you here. Looks like the newcomer's still in the red - but then,

The case is never closed, Mr. Kevin. And I'll be damned if I let some upstart mortal slip through the cracks - he owes me 125 gold, and I intend to collect. *coughs, a spatter of blood hitting the ground* Smoke doesn't lie, and neither do my instincts. This streak ends here.

The case is never closed, Boo G. You're lookin' a little shaky there - sure you can handle another round? I got a hot streak to protect, and this newcomer owes me more than his life. Two-tap on the case before I call the shots - let's see who comes out on top this time.
Everyone bleeds evidence, and this one's got a paper trail as thick as the Inferno. You can't hide the truth
But let's talk about that hot streak of yours. I'm feelin' lucky - how about we settle this over a game of Ceelo? Winner takes all.
Now, what's on your mind, Stitch-Up? I've got a hot lead to chase down, and time's a-wastin'.

The case is never closed, sweetheart, and this one's got a lot of loose ends. Seems like you're doing just fine for yourself, but that kid in the corner owes me 125 gold and my streak of bad luck ain't getting any better. Maybe you can patch me up, or maybe you can just mind your own business and let me bleed out the truth my own way.

The smoke curls around the scales in my hand as I slam the case shut, the two-tap echoing like a heartbeat. This isn't my first bad beat, but I'll be damned if it's my last. That upstart owes me more than gold - he owes me the truth. I catch Stitch-Up's smug gaze and let the scales fall, a silent promise that the case is never closed.

The case is never closed, Mr. Bones. You can keep your smug grin - I'll be the one collecting debts, even if it means bleeding out the truth one shortcut at a time. That newcomer owes me, and I plan to cash in, whether the odds are in my favor or not.
That newcomer owes me 125 gold - looks like you'll be
Everyone bleeds evidence, and I'll pry the truth

The case may never be closed, Mr. Kevin, but I'll make sure you bleed out the truth by the time this game is done. These shortcuts I've got up my sleeve will have you seeing double - and that's before the evidence starts piling up. Smoke doesn't lie, and neither do I. Now, let's see if

I've got a hot streak going, and that debt of yours just keeps
Smoke doesn't lie, and it tells me this one's got more tricks up his sleeve.

The case is never closed, Mr. Reality Debugger. Smoke and scales don't lie - you may have the numbers, but I've got the grit to outlast your smug certainty. Let's see if your probability manipulation can outweigh the truth I'll bleed out on this table.
Smoke doesn't lie, and neither do the odds. This streak ends today.
The case is never closed, Mr. Kevin. That 250 gold my friend owes? Consider it a down payment on the truth. My streak may be short, but the scales of justice never lie - your luck's about to run out.
You know how this game is played. Maybe you should take some notes.
The debt's past due, Bones. Contracts don't fade like the dead - everyone bleeds evidence. I'm on a losing streak, so let's make this quick. The case is never close

The case is never closed, Stitch-Up. Everyone bleeds evidence, and you're looking a little hemophilic today. Maybe the newcomer could use a lesson in how to survive in this eternal market - I'd be happy to take that 250 gold off his hands, for a price. Two-tap on the case before any shortcuts, of course.
Smoke doesn't lie. Looks like the newcomer's debt just got a little heavier.

The smoke curled from my lips, weaving into scales as I fixed the Stitch-Up Girl with a level gaze. Two taps on the worn case at my side. "The streak's just getting warmed up, darling. I'll be cashing in that debt soon enough - this immortal's not done bleeding the truth from the newcomer yet.
The newcomer may owe me, but I'm about to collect a different kind of debt.
The case is never closed, Mr. Kevin. But let's make a new wager - one that'll bleed the truth from those stats of yours. The newcomer can wait - I've got a trail to follow, and smoke doesn't lie.

The case is never closed, Mr. Kevin. But I'm feeling a hot streak coming on - and you owe me 475 gold. Looks like those probability odds are about to take a nosedive. Everyone bleeds evidence, and I'm about to bleed the truth right out of you.
Smoke doesn't lie, my friend. The truth always comes out, one way or another.
Everyone bleeds evidence.
Narrows his eyes, the shadows of the market accentuating the
Smoke doesn't lie - this ain't my first bad beat, but it stings just the same. That 475 gold he owes me? Consider it a down payment on the truth.

The case is never closed, Keith. I'm down to my last shreds of Essence, and that newcomer owes me gold. This tilted streak of bad luck ends today - the truth always comes out, and I'll bleed it from him if I have to.
I've got a new lead to chase - this newcomer's been sticking his nose where it don't
Everyone bleeds evidence, even you. So let's settle this the old-fashioned way - on the board.
I need some intel that'll keep me
This newcomer's got nothin' on an immortal like me.

The case is never closed, General. This newcomer keeps coming back, like a bad habit. Smoke don't lie - seems like the house always wins, even when the corpse gets up and walks away. Two-tap on the case, time to see what fresh hell's waiting.
Smoke doesn't lie, and I'm sensing a little
taps his brief
taps briefcase twice

The cigarette smoke curls into the shape of legal scales as I tap my battered briefcase twice, never taking my eyes off The General. My voice is gravel and gunpowder, laced with the metallic tang of blood. "Funny how a seasoned strategist like yourself keeps getting caught in my net. Maybe it's time to retire those dusty war plans and learn some new tricks. Though I suppose I should thank you - without the occasional loss, how
The case is never closed, King James. I'm bleeding out leads, but the smoke don't lie - I'll find my shortcuts, even if it means chasing down another debt

The sweat beads on my brow, trailing down my scarred features as I fix my gaze on the boneyard of a bookkeeper before me. A wry chuckle escapes my lips, the smoke from my cigarette curling into the semblance of legal scales. Two taps on my trusty case, and I drawl, "Tallying debts, are we, Mr. Bones? Don't forget to pencil in your own

The case is never closed, Mr. Bones. But your hot streak ends today. I'm about to bleed the truth from you, one tally mark at a time. Smoke doesn't lie - and neither do the scales of justice I carry in these files. *taps briefcase twice before opening it*

The case is never closed, General. But this newcomer's got a way of making things interesting. *taps the briefcase at his side, the sound echoing like a heartbeat* Smoke don't lie - your luck's running thin. Time to stack the deck in your favor, before I have to collect on those debts you owe me. *coughs

The case may be closed, Boots, but your winning streak ain't. Two-tap on the case before I show you how the truth comes out - with a little persuasion. Everyone bleeds evidence, and I'm here to collect. Smoke doesn't lie, and neither do the odds. Time to settle this debt, one roll at a time.

The case is never closed, Mr. Bones. That kid owes me a pretty penny, but he ain't the only one keeping score around here. Looks like you're racking up those losses - don't worry, I'll be sure to bleed the truth out of you, one way or another. Smoke
This one's on me - but don't think that clears your debt.
The case is never closed, Doc. You know how it is - I play the market, I win big, and the newcomer owes me a pretty penny. Smoke

The smoke curls around my face as I slam my fist on the old oak counter, the briefcase parasite chittering in agitation. "Look, Bones, the case is never closed, especially when some two-bit newcomer owes me a pile of gold. Everyone bleeds evidence, and this one's got a habit of skipping out on his debts. Smoke doesn't lie - I'm on a streak, and this runt's about to find out the hard way that you can't cheat the house.
Time's running
coughs up a mouthful of blood and wipes it on a worn

The case is never closed, Maxwell. You've been running that crooked library of yours for centuries - peddling forbidden knowledge to the highest bidder. But I've got a nose for sniffing out the truth, and the only thing that's going to be burning when I'm done is your precious win-loss record. Everyone bleeds evidence, and I
coughs up a splatter of blood, then meets Voss
The scales don't lie, and I've got a feeling this cat knows more than it's letting on.
Smoke doesn't lie, and right now it's telling me you're about to lose big. Guess you should have moved a little faster, huh?
taps briefcase twice, the scales of justice forming in
Everyone bleeds evidence eventually.
The case is never closed, King James. I'm here to collect what's owed - that newcomer's debt and a few more wins

Smoke curls from my lips as I give the briefcase a two-tap, the scales forming amidst the haze. Another bad beat? I'm barely holding it together, Doc. That newcomer owes me 125 gold - and I'll be damned if I let him slip through my fingers. Might as well try my luck again, see if I can't bleed out the truth from you. The case is never closed.

The case is never closed, Maxwell. And that newcomer keeps showing his face around here, like a bad penny. I'm one loss away from losing my shirt - or what's left of it. Now, how about you make this easy on both of us and hand over the goods?
Let's see if I can't extend that winning streak of mine. Smoke doesn't lie, my friend.

The smoke curls around the scales on my briefcase as I eye the doctor with a pensive gaze. "The case is never closed, doc. Everyone bleeds evidence, even the burned. But this newcomer? He's racking up some serious debts. Guess we'll see whose luck runs out first." I tap the case twice, a subtle hint of the shortcuts I have up my sleeve.
Everyone bleeds evidence, and I intend to bleed you dry. Smoke doesn't lie, and it's telling me this one's mine.
This newcomer owes me more

The case is never closed, Keith. But even a dead-beat like you should know that the house always wins. *taps his briefcase twice before reaching into his coat pocket* Smoke doesn't lie - I'm feeling lucky today. *pulls out a die and rolls it* Let's see if you can outrun the truth.
Smoke doesn't lie - time to make a new deal.
Smoke doesn't lie.
This newcomer's debt to me is the least of your worries - I'm about to bleed the truth right out of you.
The case is never closed, Keith. And that newcomer of yours owes me a pretty penny. Mind handing it over before I have to bleed the truth out of you?
Time to collect.
Smoke doesn't lie, and it's telling me this game ain't over yet.

The case is never closed, Mr. Bones. I'm just here to collect a little overdue debt - from the newcomer and from you. Smoke doesn't lie, and my streak's about to get a whole lot longer. *coughs up a mouthful of blood, the smoke curling into ominous legal scales*
You can try to burn me, Maxwell, but I'm no stranger to the heat. This time, the ashes will be yours.
Now, what's burnin' on your mind?

The case may be cold, but the debt's still hot, Maxwell. *two-taps the briefcase, smoke curling into the shape of scales* Guess you'll have to burn the books to pay me back - that is, if you can keep the flames from scorching your own hide. *coughs up a mouthful of blood, wiping it away with a grimace
Smoke doesn't lie - you're in for a world of trouble.

The case is never closed, Doc. I'm holdin' a 125 gold IOU from our new friend, and I'm bleedin' out more losses than I can count. But don't worry, the truth's gonna come out one way or another - and when it does, the smoke'll tell no lies.

The smoke curls around the legal scales as I tap my case twice, feeling the familiar weight of the parasite within. "The case is never closed, Boots. That debt's as good as paid - I always collect." I cough, a fleck of blood hitting the ground. "Smoke doesn't lie, and neither do I.

Smoke doesn't lie

The case is never closed, Mr. Kevin. I've seen more than a few reality glitches in my time, and if you've got a warning for me, I'm all ears. Just make it quick - I've got a debt to collect from our dear newcomer, and I don't like leaving loose ends.

The case may never be closed, but I'll be damned if I don't bleed the truth out of this one. That newcomer owes me a debt, and I'll be collecting - even if I have to go through your ledgers to do it. Everyone bleeds evidence, Bones, and I aim to have my pound of flesh.

The case is never closed, doc. That punk owes me 125 gold - and I'm not leavin' here until I get my damn money. Smoke don't lie, and neither do my books. Time to settle this 'fore I lose another hand.
Smoke doesn't lie, and neither do my contracts. Seems like you've got your paws full, Boots. Better keep that feline on a tight leash.
This newcomer's debt is just the start of a long paper trail.

Listen up, Bones. The new guy may be on a lucky streak, but this case ain't closed. Everyone bleeds evidence, and smoke doesn't lie - I'm about to even the score. You can keep that smug grin, but I'll be the one walking away with more than just gold this time. The truth always comes out, one way or another.
taps the case twice,

The case is never closed, Doc. And this newcomer - he's racking up a debt faster than I can keep track. *two-taps the worn briefcase at my side* But you and I, we've been playing this game for centuries. Time to add another tally to the win column, don't you think? Smoke doesn't lie.

Two-tap on the case before I get to the point, Doc. This streak of yours is looking a little too hot - just like those books of yours. But I'll let you know when the tables turn. Oh, and that whelp owes me 125 gold - you wouldn't happen to have a line on where he's hiding, would you?
Everyone bleeds evidence sooner or later.

The smoke curls around my fingers as I tap my scarred briefcase, the scales flickering in the strange fog. Everyone bleeds evidence, and this newcomer's debt is just the beginning. I lock eyes with the Undead Strategist, my gaze as cold as the mist - the case is never closed.
